refsect2.title: epsara_data_matrix_set_and_expand ()
refsect2.programlisting: EpsaraDataMatrix * epsara_data_matrix_set_and_expand (EpsaraDataMatrix *matrix, gint i, gint j, gdouble x);
refsect2.para: Sets or expands the matrix. If the indizes are out of range of the matrix-size, a new matrix will be allocated and stored in the return pointer. If one of the indizes is negativ, the matrix will be shifted by the negative value and the value at zero will be set for the new value. All newly generated values are in general set to zero. If both indizes are within the range of the matrix, the value at the index will be set to the new value and the function will return the old matrix.

Annotation: Caused by limited development-capacity, we use the GslMatrix as underlying structure. As there is so far no reallocation function for the GslMatrix availabe, this function might be ineffective for the performance in some corner cases. Avoid usage as much as possible.

refsect2.title: epsara_data_matrix_integrate_column ()
refsect2.programlisting: gdouble epsara_data_matrix_integrate_column (EpsaraDataMatrix *matrix, gint peek_column, gint integrate_column, gboolean sort_matrix, gdouble start_value, gdouble end_value);
refsect2.para:
Integrates the given matrix over the peek_column . If sort_matrix is set to TRUE, the matrix will be sorted, before starting the integration. This can be deactivated for performance reasons. However beware, that if the matrix is not sorted along the peek_column -column, the first appearence of two neighboring values around the start_value and stop_value in the peek_column
will be used for the integration. Therfor make sure the matrix is sorted along the peek_column for a correct result.

entry.para: the column containing the function values that will be integrated
if set to TRUE, the matrix will be sorted along the peek_column before integration
